metadata.title: CVE-2019-11190 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The Linux kernel before 4.8 allows local users to bypass ASLR on setuidprograms (such as /bin/su) because install_exec_creds() is called too latein load_elf_binary() in fs/binfmt_elf.c, and thus the ptrace_may_access()check has a race condition when reading /proc/pid/stat.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11190` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.4.0-149.175
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-149.175
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.4.0-149.175
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-149.175
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-149.175
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-149.175
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-149.175
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.4.0-149.175
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1110.118
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1114-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1114.119
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1084-aws - 4.4.0-1084.94
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1047-kvm - 4.4.0-1047.53
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-149.175').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
